item.title: Oil's June Outlook Hinges on Supply Trends
item.description: Oil prices jumped for a second day after the U.S. Senate passed a bill averting a default, and focus now turns to this weekend’s OPEC+ meeting at which analysts broadly expect the group to keep production quotas unchanged.

item.title: Dollar's Drop on Possible Fed Pause Puts Extra Focus on US Jobs Data
item.description: The dollar continued to fall after Fed officials hinted at a pause in raising rates in June, and non-farm payrolls data could help determine whether losses continue, ING said.

item.title: Base Metals Rise, Gold Steady as Investors Look to US Jobs Report
item.description: Base metals prices were pushing higher, while gold was flat in early London trading, with investors looking to the U.S. jobs report as the next big macroeconomic indicator.

item.title: Twitter's Top Content Moderation and Safety Executive Leaves
item.description: Ella Irwin, who declined to discuss her reason for leaving, departed on a day when Elon Musk said Twitter employees erred in how they handled a documentary.

item.title: French Industrial Production Rises
item.description: French industrial output rose 0.8% in April, rebounding more than expected after falling by 1.1% in March, suggesting some pressures on output could be easing as supply bottlenecks loosen.

item.title: Spanish Bond Spreads Unlikely to Widen for Now Amid Election Risks
item.description: SocGen recommends long positions in five-to-seven-year Spanish government bonds versus Portuguese peers amid election risks, but doesn’t expect widening pressure on the Spanish-German yield spread, and added that Spanish government bonds remain cheap relative to peers.

item.title: Senate Approves Deal Raising Debt Ceiling, Averting Default
item.description: The legislation now goes to President Biden for his signature ahead of Monday, when the Treasury Department has said the government will run out of money to pay all of its bills.

item.title: Hong Kong Shares Rise 3.7% After Debt-Ceiling Deal Clears Congress
item.description: Hong Kong’s Hang Seng Index rose 3.7% to 18883.22, extending gains after the U.S. debt-ceiling deal cleared Congress, which removes the risk of a default.

item.title: California Spent $17 Billion on Homelessness. It's Not Working.
item.description: The Wood Street encampment for years drew people with nowhere to live, until a fire made finding a solution an urgent—and frustrating—task.

item.title: Apple's savings account, a partnership with Goldman, launched in April to great fanfare. Some customers say it has been hard to get their money out.
item.description: Apple’s savings account, a partnership with Goldman, launched in April to great fanfare. Some customers say it has been hard to get their money out.

item.title: Boeing delayed a long-awaited astronaut flight after identifying new safety issues on its spacecraft for such missions.
item.description: Boeing delayed a long-awaited astronaut flight after identifying new safety issues on its spacecraft for such missions.

item.title: Macy's cut its full-year outlook for sales and profit. Discount retailer Dollar General also lowered its financial targets for the year.
item.description: Macy’s cut its full-year outlook for sales and profit. Discount retailer Dollar General also lowered its financial targets for the year.

item.title: EU regulators plan to subject Twitter to a stress test to determine how well it complies with Europe's new digital-content law.
item.description: EU regulators plan to subject Twitter to a stress test to determine how well it complies with Europe’s new digital-content law.

item.title: Vanguard Group was fined and censured by Finra for errors that appeared in more than eight million account statements.
item.description: Vanguard Group was fined and censured by Finra for errors that appeared in more than eight million account statements.

item.title: Some small businesses are finding it more difficult to get new loans or have had their existing credit lines cut as banks tighten lending standards.
item.description: Some small businesses are finding it more difficult to get new loans or have had their existing credit lines cut as banks tighten lending standards.

item.title: Major U.S. stock indexes notched gains, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials advancing 1%, 1.3% and 0.5%, respectively.
item.description: Major U.S. stock indexes notched gains, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials advancing 1%, 1.3% and 0.5%, respectively.

item.title: Companies are finding crafty ways to make their bottom lines look better, and a measure of the likelihood of earnings manipulation is at its highest level in about 40 years.
item.description: Companies are finding crafty ways to make their bottom lines look better, and a measure of the likelihood of earnings manipulation is at its highest level in about 40 years.

item.title: The Senate passed wide-ranging legislation that suspends the debt ceiling while cutting federal spending, backing a bipartisan deal struck by Biden and McCarthy to avert a U.S. default and sending the measure to the president's desk.
item.description: The Senate passed wide-ranging legislation that suspends the debt ceiling while cutting federal spending, backing a bipartisan deal struck by Biden and McCarthy to avert a U.S. default and sending the measure to the president’s desk.

item.title: Trian co-founder and investment chief Garden is stepping down, according to people familiar with the matter, amid a reshuffle of the activist investor's top ranks.
item.description: Trian co-founder and investment chief Garden is stepping down, according to people familiar with the matter, amid a reshuffle of the activist investor’s top ranks.

item.title: The nation's top auto-safety regulator is failing to meet its own targets for completing investigations into defects that could put drivers at risk, a government audit found.
item.description: The nation’s top auto-safety regulator is failing to meet its own targets for completing investigations into defects that could put drivers at risk, a government audit found.
